title: rustc -o /dev/null attempts to create a temporary directory in /dev

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-cli
labels.description: Area: Command line interface to the compiler.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

Compiling with `-o /dev/null` in order to see any compilation errors fails with a permissions error:

```
error:` couldn't create a temp dir: Permission denied (os error 13) at path "/dev/rmetaXXXXXX
```

I'm trying to use emacs to edit rust code following the examples in the rust book and flycheck (which is a linter) runs `rustc` with `-o /dev/null --emit=mir` to avoid creating any binary (see [the flycheck code here](https://github.com/flycheck/flycheck/blob/master/flycheck.el#L11648)). This works fine in rustc versions between 1.18.0 and 1.63.0 but breaks in versions 1.64.0 or later.

```
$ cat main.rs 
fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}
$ rustup run 1.63.0 rustc -o /dev/null --emit=mir main.rs 
$ rustup run 1.64.0 rustc -o /dev/null --emit=mir main.rs 
error: couldn't create a temp dir: Permission denied (os error 13) at path "/dev/rmeta4bBAfw"

error: aborting due to previous error

$ rustup run nightly rustc -o /dev/null --emit=mir main.rs 
error: couldn't create a temp dir: Permission denied (os error 13) at path "/dev/rmetajHRil9"

error: aborting due to previous error

$ rustup run stable rustc -o /dev/null --emit=mir main.rs 
error: couldn't create a temp dir: Permission denied (os error 13) at path "/dev/rmetaimL43B"

error: aborting due to previous error

$ rustup run stable rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.69.0 (84c898d65 2023-04-16)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc
commit-date: 2023-04-16
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.69.0
LLVM version: 15.0.7
$ rustup run nightly rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.71.0-nightly (a368898de 2023-05-02)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a368898de758e1b8def6c9060044a5b40eb79e84
commit-date: 2023-05-02
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.71.0-nightly
LLVM version: 16.0.2
```

I expected to see this happen: I'd expect compiling to `/dev/null` to either not attempt to create a temporary directory or to create it in `/tmp` instead of `/dev`.

Instead, this happened: Compiling to `/dev/null` attempts to create a directory in `/dev` but lacks the permissions to do so.
